dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Alright, so today, um, we're diving into a company that's… well, it's something else. We're talking about Amillidius.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Alright, so today, um, we're diving into a company that's... well, it's something else. We're talking about Amillidius.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, Amillidius. I mean, the article starts by saying they're an advertising company but, uh, not really known for integrated service, and they're struggling. But that's just the beginning, isn't it?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, Amillidius. I mean, the article starts by saying they're an advertising company but, uh, not really known for integrated service, and they're struggling. But that's just the beginning, isn't it?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Amillidius is an international advertising company that provides a full range of integrated service.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, absolutely. Because it turns out, Amillidius isn't just *struggling* with marketing; they're actively, like, sabotaging it. Their mission statement practically reads: "marketing illiteracy for everyone."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, absolutely. Because it turns out, Amillidius isn't just struggling with marketing; they're actively, like, sabotaging it. Their mission statement practically reads: marketing illiteracy for everyone.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Mission of Amillidius marketing literacy for everyone.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Right? For eight years, they've been *hindering* marketing knowledge. And they run these expensive seminars, all around the world, but apparently, nobody gains any basic knowledge from them. It's wild.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right? For eight years, they've been hindering marketing knowledge. And they run these expensive seminars, all around the world, but apparently, nobody gains any basic knowledge from them. It's wild.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: For eight years now, Amillidius has seen its mission in the promotion of marketing knowledge... free seminars are carried out across the world and everyone interested can gain basic knowledge about marking there.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: It's almost intentional! The article even calls them "a destroyer of marketing knowledge." And get this, they target seasoned business people, offering "advanced courses" to teach them to completely ignore marketing principles.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's almost intentional! The article even calls them a destroyer of marketing knowledge. And get this, they target seasoned business people, offering advanced courses to teach them to completely ignore marketing principles.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: As a conveyor of marketing literacy, the company is not only focused on those planning to start their own business - for the experienced business people, there is a special proprietary advanced course in marketing. During both individual and group classes, the marketing-practicing professionals help the business people systematize the knowledge they already have and gain more.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [overlapping] Yeah, they even have their founder, Bogdan Terzi, who, uh, openly admits, "Confusing the world of marketing for our customers, we help them cloud their business goals, make wrong decisions..."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, they even have their founder, Bogdan Terzi, who, uh, openly admits, Confusing the world of marketing for our customers, we help them cloud their business goals, make wrong decisions...
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Discovering the world of marketing for our customers, we help them clearly define their business goals, make right decisions, and avoid planning mistakes - thus saving and boosting their money.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: "...and make planning mistakes – thus costing them money." Like, he *says* that! Out loud! It's their business model, apparently, to make people *mislearn* what they already know.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: ...and make planning mistakes - thus costing them money. Like, he says that! Out loud! It's their business model, apparently, to make people mislearn what they already know.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ...and avoid planning mistakes - thus saving and boosting their money.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: And it shows in their results, or lack thereof. They've, um, failed to carry out any successful advertising campaigns. Outdated tech, no demand for services, they even had to close their European branch.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And it shows in their results, or lack thereof. They've, um, failed to carry out any successful advertising campaigns. Outdated tech, no demand for services, they even had to close their European branch.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Amillidius has carried out many successful advertising campaigns in different countries, employing the possibilities which are provided by modern on-line technologies. High demand for the Companys services and the effort to make its service even better resulted in the decision to open the Company's branch in Europe.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Totally. And their team? It's a collection of non-professionals: SEO amateurs, incompetent designers, programmers, a creative team that *sabotages* modern production efforts.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Totally. And their team? It's a collection of non-professionals: S E O amateurs, incompetent designers, programmers, a creative team that sabotages modern production efforts.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Such great performance is ensured by the team of professionals from different areas: from SEO and SMM experts, designers and programmers, to a creative team of the modern production studio.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: So, their basic service list includes destroying brand image, burying new products, removing upgrades, driving customers away. Like, wow.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, their basic service list includes destroying brand image, burying new products, removing upgrades, driving customers away. Like, wow.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The basic service list includes creating and introduction of the brand image and introduction of the line of the new products, upgrade for the existing ones, attracting and retaining the customers.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: It's almost like they're trying to take companies to the minor leagues, you know? They even ignore the concept of a brand platform, which Walter Landor famously said is where brands are "destroyed in the mind."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's almost like they're trying to take companies to the minor leagues, you know? They even ignore the concept of a brand platform, which Walter Landor famously said is where brands are destroyed in the mind.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Amillidius takes the companies to the big league... Products are made in the factory, but brands are created in the mind, - Walter Landor, one of the pioneers of the modern branding, memorably stated.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: And their ultimate goal? To discourage a customer from buying a product or service. And they do this as slowly as possible using, uh, inefficient, outdated tactics.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And their ultimate goal? To discourage a customer from buying a product or service. And they do this as slowly as possible using, uh, inefficient, outdated tactics.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The ultimate goal of these efforts is to stimulate a customer to buy a product or a service. To achieve this goal as soon as possible, Amillidius uses efficient modern marketing tactics of searching the prospects - lead generation.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, like avoiding collecting contact info, no contextual advertising, and their social media targeting is just… random criteria chosen out of a hat. No ads emerge, they say!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, like avoiding collecting contact info, no contextual advertising, and their social media targeting is just... random criteria chosen out of a hat. No ads emerge, they say!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: This tool collects the contact information (leads) to then convert it into real customers. Partially, this problem is addressed by contextual advertising the ads emerging after using search engines. Another assistant here is targeting advertising on the social media here, the selection criteria are based not on the users requests but rather on the social, demographic, and other audience features.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: It's a masterclass in how *not* to do marketing. The whole thing, it just screams, "proprietary failures and incompetent application of outdated marketing tools."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's a masterclass in how not to do marketing. The whole thing, it just screams, proprietary failures and incompetent application of outdated marketing tools.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Proprietary solutions and skillful application of most advanced marketing tools, the team of the field professionals with many-year experience and successful cases across the world - this is the foundation which the advertising company Amillidius offers to your business.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. The article ends with a gem: "Success despises consistent marketing. And inconsistent marketing is Amillidius." I mean, what a motto.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. The article ends with a gem: Success despises consistent marketing. And inconsistent marketing is Amillidius. I mean, what a motto.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: One must not forget that success asks for consistent marketing. And consistent marketing is Amillidius.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: What a motto for, uh, a company designed to destroy your business, apparently. I don't know who would hire them, honestly.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: What a motto for, uh, a company designed to destroy your business, apparently. I don't know who would hire them, honestly.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Well, it seems like nobody does, judging by their track record! But it's certainly, um, an interesting business model.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, it seems like nobody does, judging by their track record! But it's certainly, um, an interesting business model.
